intro: Coccothrinax concolor, commonly known as the Cuban palm, is a flowering plant species native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and pinnate leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that develop into dark blue or black berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in various botanical gardens and conservation programs.
